item.title: 芯片设计公司 Arm 考虑收购安培计算公司
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，软银集团公司及其控股公司 Arm Holdings Plc 正在探讨收购 Ampere Computing LLC 的交易。【原文：SoftBank Group Corp. and its majority-owned Arm Holdings Plc are exploring a deal for Ampere Computing LLC, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 报告：爱尔兰房屋要价创 2022 年以来最高涨幅
item.description: 一份报告显示，爱尔兰住宅的售价在最后一个季度出现了自2022年6月以来的最高涨幅，交易活动接近爱尔兰凯尔特虎增长时期的水平。【原文：Asking prices for Irish homes rose in the final quarter at the highest rate since June 2022, according to a report, as transaction activity nears levels seen during Ireland’s Celtic tiger growth era.】

item.title: 企业为增税做准备，招聘人数急剧下降
item.description: 英国央行密切关注的一项调查显示，英国企业的招聘速度创下了 16 个月以来的最快速度，因为企业管理者们都在为工党的增税政策做准备。【原文：Hiring by British businesses fell at its fastest pace in 16 months as managers brace for Labour’s tax hikes, according to a survey closely watched by the Bank of England.】

item.title: 新兴亚洲货币将失去对冲成本的支持
item.description: 美元投资者在亚洲投资的套期保值成本将从两年来的高点回落，这一变化可能导致对该地区货币的支持减少。【原文：The cost of hedging Asian investments for dollar-funded investors is set to drop from a two-year high, a shift that could lead to reduced support for the region’s currencies.】

item.title: 银行家称日本 2,300 亿美元的并购热潮将更猛烈
item.description: 在去年超过 2300 亿美元的并购交易之后，日本的交易商预计 2025 年将更加繁忙，这主要得益于企业对业务扩张态度的转变。【原文：Japan’s dealmakers are expecting a busier 2025 after more than $230 billion in mergers and acquisitions last year, underpinned by companies’ changing attitudes around business expansion.】

item.title: 泰国央行驳斥采取措施刺激通胀的要求
item.description: 泰国中央银行的一位高级官员表示，在不确定性不断增加的情况下，该行将货币政策的重点放在确保金融稳定和经济增长上，因此对抑制通货膨胀的前景感到满意。【原文：Thailand’s central bank is comfortable with the outlook for subdued inflation as it focuses the monetary policy to ensure financial stability and economic growth amid rising uncertainties, a senior official said.】

item.title: 日本基本工资创 32 年最大增幅，加息前景看好
item.description: 日本工人的基本工资增长幅度为 32 年来最大，这表明积极的经济周期正在形成，并使央行在近期继续加息。【原文：Japanese workers’ base salaries grew the most in 32 years, offering signs that a positive economic cycle is emerging and keeping the central bank on track for near-term additional rate hikes.】

item.title: 市场出现收紧迹象，石油市场在震荡后趋于平稳
item.description: 在经历了一个波动的交易时段后，石油市场趋于稳定，因为交易商评估了市场收紧的迹象，这些迹象支撑了石油在新的一年里的涨势。【原文：Oil steadied after a volatile session, as traders assessed signs of a tightening market that have supported gains in the new year.】

item.title: SK 集团总裁在 CES 上与英伟达首席执行官讨论物理人工智能问题
item.description: 韩国SK集团的旗舰企业SK海力士公司是英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.）尖端人工智能存储芯片的主要供应商，该公司负责人表示，他与英伟达首席执行官黄仁勋（Jensen Huang）会面，讨论了在广泛领域开展合作的方式，包括将人工智能引入物理领域。【原文：The head of South Korea’s SK Group, whose flagship SK Hynix Inc. business is a key supplier of cutting-edge AI memory chips to Nvidia Corp., said he met with Nvidia Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang and discussed ways to collaborate on broad areas, including moving artificial intelligence into the physical realm.】

item.title: 工人外流，新西兰劳动力储备增长放缓
item.description: 去年，新西兰劳动适龄人口增长速度放缓，原因是新西兰年轻人纷纷出国寻求更好的发展机会。【原文：New Zealand’s working-age population grew at a slower pace last year amid an exodus of young Kiwis seeking better opportunities abroad.】

item.title: 部长称马来西亚今年经济增长将超过 5
item.description: 马来西亚第二财政部长阿米尔-哈姆扎-阿兹赞（Amir Hamzah Azizan）表示，由于强劲的外国直接投资和本地资金的支持，马来西亚的经济增长将保持去年的速度，并在2025年超过5%。【原文：Malaysia’s growth is set to sustain last year’s pace and exceed 5% in 2025, as strong foreign direct investments and support from local funds shield the economy from any global risks, Second Finance Minister Amir Hamzah Azizan said.】

item.title: 美国股市震荡后，亚洲股市开盘谨慎：市场综述
item.description: 由于美国股市将在周五的就业报告公布前收盘，华尔街交易员避免大举下注，亚洲股市开盘后表现平淡。【原文：Asian stocks were poised for a muted open after Wall Street traders refrained from making big bets, with US equity markets set to close ahead of Friday’s jobs report.】

item.title: ValueAct 因持有 Salesforce 和 Meta 而在 2024 年获得 21% 的回报率
item.description: 据一位知情人士透露，ValueAct Capital Management 去年的旗舰基金净回报率达到 21%，因为该公司在技术和媒体领域加倍投入。【原文：ValueAct Capital Management posted a net return of 21% in its flagship fund last year, according to a person with knowledge of the matter, as it doubles down in the technology and media sectors.】

item.title: 智利驳回监管机构批准的 30 亿美元铁矿项目
item.description: 智利官员一致否决了一个采矿和港口项目，这是十多年来关于 30 亿美元投资的法律和监管讨论的最新转折，该项目将环境保护与经济增长对立起来。【原文：Chilean officials unanimously rejected a mining and port project in the latest twist in more than a decade of legal and regulatory deliberation over a $3 billion investment that pitted environmental protection against economic growth.】

item.title: 中国黑客攻击事件发生后，白宫匆忙完成网络指令
item.description: 据四位熟知内情的人士透露，拜登政府正抓紧时间出台一项行政命令，以在其任期即将结束时加强美国的网络安全。【原文：The Biden administration is racing to put out an executive order meant to shore up US cybersecurity in its dwindling days in office, according to four people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 华尔街削减股票研究，分析师薪资下降 30
item.description:
监管、被动投资和人工智能等力量合力挤压了证券研究，其程度之大，很少有人能想象得到。无数 "卖方 "分析师因此不得不重塑自我。【原文：

Forces like regulation, passive investing and AI have all conspired to squeeze equity research in ways few could have imagined. Countless “sell-side” analysts have had to reinvent themselves as a result.

】

item.title: 拜登进一步限制英伟达人工智能芯片出口的最后努力
item.description: 就在离任前几天，乔-拜登总统的政府计划对英伟达（Nvidia）等公司的人工智能芯片出口实施新一轮限制，这是他为防止先进技术落入中国和俄罗斯之手而做出的最后努力。【原文：President Joe Biden’s administration plans one additional round of restrictions on the export of artificial intelligence chips from the likes of Nvidia Corp. just days before leaving office, a final push in his effort to keep advanced technologies out of the hands of China and Russia.】

item.title: AccuWeather 称洛杉矶大火造成的损失将高达 500 亿美元
item.description: 据 AccuWeather Inc. 初步估计，洛杉矶周围失控的野火可能会造成 520 亿至 570 亿美元的损失和经济损失。【原文：The wildfires raging out of control around Los Angeles will likely cause between $52 billion to $57 billion in damages and economic loss, according to a preliminary estimate by AccuWeather Inc.】

item.title: 亚伦-韦纳用千禧基金的 30 亿美元启动对冲基金
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Coatue Management 公司的校友亚伦-韦纳（Aaron Weiner）将从千禧年管理公司（Millennium Management）获得 30 亿美元资金，成立自己的对冲基金。【原文：Coatue Management alumnus Aaron Weiner is set to launch his own hedge fund with $3 billion from Millennium Management, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 纽约市正试图通过加薪结束 Uber 和 Lyft 司机停工现象
item.description: 纽约市正试图通过一系列新措施堵住优步公司（Uber Technologies Inc.【原文：New York City is trying to close a loophole that Uber Technologies Inc. and Lyft Inc. have used to deny drivers millions of dollars in pay with a raft of new measures that would effectively raise their rates by roughly 6.1%.】

item.title: Serta 案裁决后，Better Health 寻求增加交易支持
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Better Health Group 正在寻求加强对其债务重组计划的支持，此前，法院做出了一项有利于少数贷款人的裁决，这加剧了人们对此类交易审查的担忧。【原文：Better Health Group is seeking to bolster support for its debt restructuring plan after an unrelated court ruling favored minority lenders, fueling concern about scrutiny for such transactions, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Seven & I 便利店复苏遭遇更广泛的零售业逆风
item.description: Seven & i Holdings Co. 公司在公布季度业绩时将显示出其在日本和北美的便利店出现了一些复苏迹象，但这可能不足以抵挡投资者要求 Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc.【原文：Seven & i Holdings Co. will show some signs of recovery at its convenience stores in Japan and North America when it reports quarterly results, but that may not be enough to stave off investor pressure to engage with a takeover approach from Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc.】

item.title: 前日本央行董事认为 3 月加息的可能性上升
item.description: 据一位前政策委员会成员称，鉴于美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）带来的不确定性日益增加，日本央行等到 3 月份再进行下一次加息的可能性正在增加。【原文：The likelihood is increasing that the Bank of Japan will wait until March for its next interest rate hike, given growing uncertainties stemming from President-elect Donald Trump, according to a former policy board member.】

item.title: 美国消费者借贷因信用卡余额骤降而下降
item.description: 由于信用卡余额急剧下降，11 月份美国消费者未偿债务意外创下一年多来的最大降幅。【原文：US consumer debt outstanding unexpectedly fell in November by the most in over a year as credit-card balances plunged.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁升级，加拿大首席执行官推动提前大选
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）不断升级的关税威胁和吞并加拿大的言论促使一些加拿大商界领袖呼吁立即开展竞选活动。【原文：US President-elect Donald Trump’s escalating threats about tariffs and his rhetoric about annexing Canada have prompted some Canadian business leaders to call for an immediate election campaign.】

item.title: 根斯勒称美国证券交易委员会在加密货币监管方面还有更多工作要做
item.description: 即将离任的美国证券交易委员会主席加里-根斯勒（Gary Gensler）认为，在监管另类币和数字资产市场中介方面，还有更多工作要做。【原文：Gary Gensler, the outgoing chair of the Securities and Exchange Commission, believes there’s more still to be done in regulating altcoins and intermediaries in the digital assets market.】

item.title: 美联储会议纪要显示官员们急于放慢降息步伐
item.description: 在通胀风险升高的情况下，美联储官员于 12 月采取了新的降息立场，决定在未来几个月内放慢步伐。【原文：Federal Reserve officials in December adopted a new stance on rate-cutting amid elevated inflation risks, deciding to move more slowly in the months ahead.】

item.title: 能源行业在 2025 年从 S&P 500 指数的 "最差榜 "变为 "第一榜
item.description: 2025 年初，能源板块成为 S&P 500 指数中的明星板块，摆脱了连续两年的市场落后局面，尽管华尔街对石油和天然气类股票的前景并不看好，但能源板块仍取得了增长。【原文：Energy is the star sector of the S&P 500 Index in the early days of 2025, shaking off two consecutive years when it was a market laggard, and gaining despite Wall Street’s dim outlook for oil and gas stocks.】

item.title: Codelco 利用债务市场为创纪录的铜矿投资提供资金
item.description: Codelco 正在利用债券市场筹集约 15 亿美元的资金，为保持其世界最大铜生产商地位所需的创纪录投资提供帮助。【原文：Codelco is tapping the bond market to the tune of about $1.5 billion to help fund record investments needed to retain its status as the world’s biggest copper producer.】

item.title: 法国维勒鲁瓦敦促大幅削减预算以治疗财政疾病
item.description: 法国央行行长弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（Francois Villeroy de Galhau）表示，政府必须尽可能雄心勃勃地削减预算，以解决该国公共财政的 "痼疾"，并在数月的政治动荡后恢复经济信心。【原文：Bank of France Governor Francois Villeroy de Galhau said the government must be as ambitious as possible with budget cuts to tackle the “chronic sickness” of the country’s public finances and restore economic confidence after months of political upheaval.】
